questionTitle: Which of the following has core services shown in the following figure?
questionExplanation: Windows Live is based around five core services.

questionOption1: Windows Live is a collection of cloud-based applications and services
questionOption2: Every Windows Live applications run as standalone applications and are available to users directly through a browser
questionOption3: Microsoft has rolled out Windows Live in sets of releases they describe as four waves
questionExplanation: The first wave was a rebranding of several Microsoft MSN applications and services in late 2005.

questionTitle: Which of the following is a management utility for a domain using SOAP and RPC?
questionExplanation: Alerts enables Windows Live Alerts from an RSS feed.

questionTitle: Which of the following was formerly called Windows Live Dev?
questionExplanation: Developers access the services for Windows Live Services through a collection of APIs and controls called Windows Live Messenger Connect.

questionOption1: Messenger Connect was released as part of the Windows Live Wave 2
questionOption2: There is a current limit of 1 GB for each SQL Azure Database
questionOption3: Queries against a single database are unified
questionExplanation: Messenger Connect was released as part of the Windows Live Wave 4 at the end of June 2010.

questionTitle: Which of the following way can be used to access Windows Live?
questionOption1: By navigating to the service from the command on the navigation bar at the top of Windows Live
questionOption2: By directly entering the URL of the service
questionOption3: By selecting the application from the Windows Live Essentials folder on the Start menu
questionExplanation: If you havenâ€™t signed into Windows Live during your session, Windows Live requests that you do so before allowing you to proceed.

questionTitle: ___________ is Management service for Windows Live ID and relationships.
questionExplanation: Some Windows Live applications are client-side applications, many others are Web-based applications, some are mobile apps, and an important subset of these services are available to developers through the Windows Live Messenger Connect APIs.

questionTitle: Which of the following synchronizes information obtained from RSS and ATOM sources?
questionExplanation: Live Framework includes the Live Mesh tools from Visual Studio 2008 and Visual Web Developer Express Edition 2008.

questionTitle: Which of the following service use XML-RPC calls to get and send Weblog data?
questionExplanation: Spaces integrates Windows Live Spaces, Windows Live Events, Windows Live Photos, and Windows Live Profile into applications.

questionTitle: Which of the following service allows applications to incorporate the features of the Windows Live Writer?
questionExplanation: Additional capabilities include features for creating and managing blogs, adding more content, and customizing the Windows Live Writer user interface.
